text: Punishment of qatl-e-amd (Murder). Punished with death as qisas, or death/life imprisonment as ta'zir depending on circumstances.
Attempt to commit qatl-e-amd (Attempted Murder). Punishable with imprisonment up to 10 years.
Shajjah/Hurt cases. Punishments vary based on nature of injury (Itlaf-i-udw, etc.). Includes Arsh and Daman.
Punishment for Rape (Zina-bil-Jabr). Death or imprisonment of not less than 10 years to life. Enhanced for gang rape.
Punishment for theft (Chori). Imprisonment up to 3 years or fine or both.
Theft in dwelling house. Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine.
Theft by clerk or servant of master's property. Imprisonment up to 7 years.
Punishment for Robbery. Rigorous imprisonment 3 to 10 years. Up to 14 years if on highway at night.
Punishment for Dacoity (Gang Robbery). Life imprisonment or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years.
Punishment for Criminal Breach of Trust. Imprisonment up to 7 years.
Cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property. Imprisonment up to 7 years.
Forgery for purpose of cheating. Imprisonment up to 7 years.
Using a forged document as genuine. Same punishment as forgery.
Dishonestly issuing a cheque which is dishonoured on presentation. Imprisonment up to 3 years.
Enticing or taking away a woman. Often used in 'Love Marriage' kidnapping cases. Imprisonment up to 7 years.
Adultery (Zina). While Hudood Laws apply, PPC 497 deals with enticing married women. 5 years imprisonment.
Depriving woman of inheritance or forced marriage. Imprisonment 5 to 10 years.
Punishment for Defamation. Simple imprisonment up to 2 years or fine.
Criminal Intimidation (Threats). Up to 2 years (Simple) or 7 years (if threat to kill/grevious hurt).
Abetment. If you help someone commit a crime, you get the same punishment as the crime itself.
Common Intention. If a group commits a crime with a shared plan, EACH member is liable for the whole crime.
Disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant (e.g. Section 144 violation). Up to 6 months.
Use of derogatory remarks in respect of the Holy Prophet (PBUH). Punishment: Death.
Dishonestly receiving stolen property. Imprisonment up to 5 years.
Punishment for House-Trespass. Imprisonment up to 1 year.
House-trespass after preparation for hurt/assault. Imprisonment up to 7 years.
Kidnapping or abducting with intent to wrongfully confine. Imprisonment up to 7 years.
Kidnapping, abducting or inducing woman to compel for marriage. Life imprisonment.
Punishment for Qatl-i-Shibh-i-Amd (Unintentional Murder but with intent to harm). Diyat and imprisonment up to 25 years.
Qatl-i-Khata (Accidental Killing). Punishment is Diyat (Blood Money) and potentially 5 years jail.
Obstructing public servant in discharge of public functions. Up to 3 months jail.
Assault or criminal force to woman with intent to outrage her modesty. Up to 2 years.
Stripping a woman of her clothes. Punishment: Death or Life Imprisonment.
Unnatural Offences (Sodomy). Imprisonment 2 years to Life.
Mischief causing damage to amount of 50 rupees (Property Damage). Up to 2 years.
Mischief committed after preparation made for causing death or hurt. Up to 5 years.
Possession of forged or counterfeit currency-notes. Up to 7 years.
Rioting, armed with deadly weapon. Up to 3 years.
Unlawful Assembly. Every member is guilty of offence committed in prosecution of common object.
Public servant taking gratification (Bribe) other than legal remuneration. Up to 3 years.
Criminal Breach of Trust by Public Servant or Banker. Life Imprisonment or 10 years.
Giving false information to public servant. Up to 6 months imprisonment or fine.
Defiling extracts of the Holy Quran. Life Imprisonment.
Making or possessing instruments for counterfeiting currency. Up to 7 years.
Hate Speech. Disseminating information to glorify an offence or hate speech. Up to 7 years.
Offences against dignity of a natural person (Online Defamation/Harassment). Up to 3 years.
Cyber stalking (Harassment). Use of internet to stalk or harass. Up to 3 years.
Possession of Narcotics (Quantity exceeds 100g but less than 1kg). Up to 7 years.
Possession of Narcotics (Quantity exceeds 1kg). Death penalty or Life Imprisonment.
Punishment for acts of terrorism. Death or Life Imprisonment.
Shajjah (Hurt to head/face). Punishment: Arsh (compensation) + up to 2-10 years depending on fracture.
Ghayr-Jaifah (Hurt penetrating into body cavity). Punishment: Daman + up to 10 years.
Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking by night. Up to 5 years (14 years if theft intended).
Mischief by fire or explosive substance (Arson) to destroy house. Life Imprisonment or 10 years.
Punishment for Criminal Trespass. Up to 3 months.
Rash driving or riding on a public way. Up to 2 years.
Insulting modesty of a woman/Sexual Harassment in public. Up to 3 years.
Marrying again during lifetime of husband or wife (Bigamy) without permission. Up to 7 years.
Qatl-i-Shibh-i-Amd of unborn child (Causing miscarriage). Diyat + up to 10 years.
Voluntarily causing grievous hurt (breaking bone etc.). Up to 7 years.
First Information Report (FIR). Police must register FIR for cognizable offenses. Cannot refuse.
Police officer's power to investigate cognizable case without Magistrate's order.
Police Report. After investigation, police submit report (challan) to Magistrate.
Bail in bailable offenses. Person accused of bailable offense has RIGHT to bail as of right.
Bail in non-bailable offenses. Court MAY grant bail if reasonable grounds that accused not guilty or further inquiry needed.
Anticipatory Bail. Person apprehending arrest may apply for pre-arrest bail in High Court or Sessions Court.
Arrest without warrant. Police can arrest without warrant for cognizable offenses or court warrants.
Justice of Peace powers. Sessions Judge can order FIR registration if police refuse.
Judicial Magistrate can also act as Justice of Peace for FIR disputes.
Plea Bargaining. Accused can plead guilty for reduced sentence (not allowed for terrorism/corruption cases).
Acquittal at any stage if no reasonable ground to believe accused committed offense.
Proceeding against persons for giving false evidence or fabricating false evidence.
Police power to examine witnesses during investigation (statement under 161).
Recording of confessions and statements before Magistrate (judicial confession).
Power to examine accused (right to explanation in court).
Procedure in disputes as to immovable property (Land Dispute Resolution).
Power to issue order in urgent cases of nuisance or apprehended danger (Section 144 Order).
Security of person. No person shall be deprived of life or liberty save in accordance with law.
Safeguards as to arrest and detention. Right to be informed of grounds, consult lawyer, produce before magistrate within 24 hours.
Right to fair trial. For determination of civil rights or criminal charges, every person has right to fair trial and due process.
Inviolability of dignity of man. The dignity of man and subject to law privacy of home shall be inviolable.
Equality of citizens. All citizens are equal before law and entitled to equal protection of law.
Jurisdiction of High Court. High Court can issue writs of habeas corpus, mandamus, prohibition, quo warranto, certiorari.
Original jurisdiction of Supreme Court (Suo Moto). Supreme Court can take suo moto action on public importance matters.
Registration of Divorce (Talaq). Husband must give written notice to chairman of union council. Divorce effective after 90 days.
Procedure for obtaining Khula. Wife files suit in Family Court. May be required to return haq mehr as consideration.
Punishment for bigamy without permission. Man contracting second marriage without permission of Arbitration Council liable to imprisonment.
Matters falling within jurisdiction of Family Court include: khula, talaq, dissolution, maintenance, dower, custody.
Custody of minor. Court decides custody in best interest of child. Generally mother for young children (Hizanat).
Powers of court regarding custody. Court can pass orders for custody, visitation rights, expenses.
Specific performance of contract. Court can order party to perform their part of contract (land sales etc).
Right to specific performance lies with party who has performed his part or is ready to perform.
Declaration of right or legal character. Person can file suit for declaration that he is owner of property or has legal right.
Perpetual injunction to prevent breach of obligation. Court can order defendant to refrain from doing certain acts.
Rejection of plaint. Court can reject plaint if it does not disclose cause of action or barred by law.
Temporary injunction (TRO). Court can grant temporary injunction to prevent defendant from doing act until suit decision.
Injunction to restrain repetition or continuance of breach.
Setting aside ex-parte decree. Defendant can apply to set aside decree passed in absence.
Appeal from original decree. Every decree can be appealed unless law expressly bars it.
Revision by High Court. High Court can call for record of case to satisfy itself about legality/propriety of decision.
Admission. Statement by party to proceeding admitting any fact in issue is called admission. Can be proved against him.
Confession caused by inducement, threat or promise is irrelevant in criminal proceeding.
Testimony of hostile or unfavourable witness. Can be cross-examined by party calling him.
Presumption as to genuineness of certified copies. Court shall presume certified copy is genuine.
Sale requires registered instrument. Sale of immovable property requires registered sale deed.
Transfer by ostensible owner. If person with consent of real owner appears as owner, transfer is valid.
Consideration. Agreement without consideration is void unless it is written, registered and between near relatives.
Unlawful consideration or object makes agreement void.
Dishonour of cheque for insufficiency of funds. Imprisonment up to 2 years or fine up to twice the cheque amount.
Extension of prescribed period in certain cases. Court can condone delay if sufficient cause shown.
